author: Reuters Editorial
title: DowDuPont expects agri division to record peak sales of $4.5 billion
text:
(Reuters) - Chemical company DowDuPont ( DWDP.N ) said on Thursday it expected its agriculture division Corteva Agriscience to post peak sales of $4.5 billion due to recent and upcoming product launches.
DowDuPont, which expects to spin off the business by June 1, 2019, said the launches of products such as the Qrome pesticide and Enlist soybeans will drive sales at the unit in North America.
The company, formed after a $130 billion merger of Dow Chemical and DuPont last year, has said it will create two other publicly traded companies to house its material sciences and specialty products businesses.
Reporting by Yashaswini Swamynathan in Bengaluru; Editing by Saumyadeb Chakrabarty
